markdown:
The first three hekatonkheires were meant to guard the gates to the [Abyss](/Planes.aspx?ID=13), but they proved too terrifying and rebellious— and so, in disgust, the gods cast them into the gulfs between the planes. Hekatonkheires titans are incomplete, monstrous progeny of the original three, from whom these titans calved like icebergs. Hekatonkheires wield interstellar darkness as a weapon and spurn the limits of physical reality, literally reaching through space with their countless arms. Filled with a drive to either discover their lost identity or create their own, they metaphysically disembowel ancient beings and cosmic magics—using the entrails to find clues regarding their own nature and parentage or to serve as raw materials for fueling some alien apotheosis. **[Recall Knowledge - Aberration](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Occultism](/Skills.aspx?ID=11)): DC 53 **[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 51 **[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 48 [Hekatonkheires Titan](/Monsters.aspx?ID=1342) **Source** [Bestiary 3](/Sources.aspx?ID=66) pg. 270 **Perception** +43; [darkvision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=12), [_true seeing_](/Spells.aspx?ID=344) **Languages** [Abyssal](/Languages.aspx?ID=12), [Aklo](/Languages.aspx?ID=13), [Celestial](/Languages.aspx?ID=16), [Common](/Languages.aspx?ID=1); [telepathy](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=37) 100 feet **Skills** [Acrobatics](/Skills.aspx?ID=1) +42, [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=3) +48, [Intimidation](/Skills.aspx?ID=7) +45, [Occultism](/Skills.aspx?ID=11) +41, [Survival](/Skills.aspx?ID=16) +39 **Str** +12 **Dex** +10 **Con** +12 **Int** +7 **Wis** +7 **Cha** +9 --- **AC** 52 [all-around vision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=1) **Fort** +44 **Ref** +40 **Will** +37 +4 status to all saves vs. [mental](/Traits.aspx?ID=106) or [divine](/Traits.aspx?ID=48) **HP** 500 **Immunities** [death](/Traits.aspx?ID=40) effects, [disease](/Traits.aspx?ID=46) **Impossible Stature** ([aura](/Traits.aspx?ID=206), [divine](/Traits.aspx?ID=48), [illusion](/Traits.aspx?ID=92), [mental](/Traits.aspx?ID=106)) 100 feet. Titans warp perception and distance around them to seem even larger and more imposing. A creature that enters or begins its turn within the emanation must succeed at a DC 48 Will save or its movement toward the titan is movement over difficult terrain (greater difficult terrain on a critical failure) for 1 round.
**[Attack of Opportunity](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=3)** The hekatonkheires gains 99 extra reactions on their turn that they can only use to make Attacks of Opportunity. --- **Speed** 60 feet; [_air walk_](/Spells.aspx?ID=6), [_freedom of movement_](/Spells.aspx?ID=128) **Melee** _void weapon_ +45 ([Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103), [reach 50 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=192), [versatile P](/Traits.aspx?ID=200), [versatile S](/Traits.aspx?ID=200)), **Damage** 4d12+18 bludgeoning plus 2d12 force **Ranged** _void weapon_ +43 ([Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103), [thrown 200 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=195), [versatile P](/Traits.aspx?ID=200), [versatile S](/Traits.aspx?ID=200)), **Damage** 4d12+18 bludgeoning plus 2d12 force **Occult Innate Spells** DC 48 - **9th** [Bind Soul](/Spells.aspx?ID=21), [Dimension Door](/Spells.aspx?ID=69), [Plane Shift](/Spells.aspx?ID=222), [Weird](/Spells.aspx?ID=375) - **Constant (10th)** [Air Walk](/Spells.aspx?ID=6), [Freedom of Movement](/Spells.aspx?ID=128), [True Seeing](/Spells.aspx?ID=344) **Demolish Veil** **Frequency** once per month; **Trigger** The titan casts [_plane shift_](/Spells.aspx?ID=222); **Effect** The titan arrives in a storm of shattered planar barriers. This has the effects of a 10th-level [_storm of vengeance_](/Spells.aspx?ID=313). **Hundred-Dimension Grasp** The titan reaches between realities to drag foes closer. They attempt an [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=3) check and compare the result to the Fortitude DCs of all foes within 120 feet. On a success, a foe is teleported to any square the titan chooses within 120 feet; on a critical success, it's also [paralyzed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=28) for 1 round. The titan can [Grab](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=18) any foe brought within 30 feet as a free action. **Hundred-Handed Whirlwind** The titan overwhelms opponents with blows both conventional and interplanar. They make one void weapon Strike against each foe within reach. Even on a failed attack (but not a critical failure), the titan deals 24 force damage to the target. This counts as three attacks for the titan's multiple attack penalty. **Send Beyond** **Requirements** The titan has a creature [grabbed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=20); **Effect** The titan thrusts the creature into a nightmare realm full of lightless hands and eyes. This has the effects of [_maze_](/Spells.aspx?ID=187) (DC 48), but the creature can use [Occultism](/Skills.aspx?ID=11) to escape in addition to Perception or [Survival](/Skills.aspx?ID=16). The titan can't use Send Beyond for 1d4 rounds. **Shape Void** The titan molds a weapon from interstellar darkness. This is a _+3 [major striking](/Equipment.aspx?ID=280) weapon_ in any form. It can't be [disarmed](/Actions.aspx?ID=41) and deals an additional 2d12 force damage. If Released, a void weapon vanishes.
Hekatonkheires Anatomy Crafters with exceptional skill can harvest a hekatonkheires's black bones before they dissolve upon the titan's death. These bones can be forged into shapeshifting weapons or refined into tuning forks that allow travel to esoteric planes.
name: Hekatonkheires Titan
